fields.meta_description: ebus, a leading bus service in Red Deer, Edmonton & Calgary, answers all your bus transportation FAQs. Discover the convenience of traveling by bus in Alberta!
fields.title: Answers to Calgary Bus Transportation & Coach Bus Service FAQs | MyEbus.ca
fields.body_content:
Ebus FAQs

1. If I miss the coach, can I simply travel on the next one?
2. Can I cancel or change my trip and receive a full refund?
3. Do I need ID or a ticket when traveling on ebus?
4. Does Ebus allow the consumption of alcoholic beverages or smoking on board?
5. What is the minimum age that a child can travel alone on Ebus?
6. How much do Ebus tickets cost?
7. Do you offer any discounted tickets?
8. Where can I purchase a ticket to travel on Ebus?
9. What information should I have ready when calling Ebus?
10. Do I have to book my trip in advance?
11. How far in advance must I arrive before departure?
12. If I need a ticket at the last minute, can I pay the driver cash?
13. Is it possible to purchase a ticket in Red Deer?
14. What amenities are on the Ebus?
15. Can I connect to a Red Arrow coach if I’m travelling on Ebus?
16. Can my child sit on my lap?
17. Can I bring a child’s car seat on-board?
18. Are pets allowed on board?
19. How many pieces of luggage can I bring on Ebus?
20. What are your baggage liability restrictions?
21. Can I bring my bicycle?
22. Can I bring my ski/snowboard equipment?
23. Can I bring my golf clubs?
24. If I require a wheelchair or scooter, can I travel on Ebus?
25. Can my attendant travel with me at a reduced price?
26. What is the maximum seat capacity on Ebus?
27. Does Ebus stop at the Calgary International Airport?
28. Is there any available overnight or day parking when I travel with Ebus?
29. I am travelling from CrossIron Mills. Where can I park?

 

 

1. If I miss the coach, can I simply travel on the next one?
Fares are non-refundable, non-transferrable and non-changeable unless upgrading to a Red Arrow Departure on the same date of travel.  Once upgraded, Red Arrow fares also become non-refundable.  Missed departures will result in forfeiture of fare and a new full fare will need to be purchased for travel.

top

 

2. Can I cancel or change my trip and receive a full refund?
Fares are non-refundable, non-transferrable and non-changeable unless upgrading to a Red Arrow Departure on the same date of travel.  Once upgraded, Red Arrow fares also become non-refundable.  Missed departures will result in forfeiture of fare and a new full fare will need to be purchased for travel.



top

 

 

3. Do I need ID or a ticket when traveling on Ebus?
You do not require a ticket as your name will be on our manifest when you check in. We reserve the right to check identification at any time.


top


 

4. Does Ebus allow the consumption of alcoholic beverages or smoking on board?
For everyone’s safety, smoking and alcoholic beverages are not permitted on Ebus. Passengers that are deemed intoxicated will not be permitted to board. ebus reserves the right to check any bags that are brought on-board at any time. In addition, any passengers caught with alcohol or smoking on board the coach will be ejected immediately. FARE WILL NOT BE REFUNDED.
 


 

top

 


5. What is the minimum age that a child can travel alone on Ebus?
Children 13 years of age or older are able to travel alone. All children 12 years old and younger must be accompanied by a guardian 13 years of age or older. Proof of age of unaccompanied children and/or guardians must be provided at time of boarding.


top

 


6. How much do ebus tickets cost?
Click here for more information on pricing for Ebus bus tickets.

 top



7. Do you offer any discounted tickets?
You can save 5% automatically when booking online at www.myebus.ca

 

top

 


8. Where can I purchase a ticket to travel on Ebus?
You can book your travel online – www.myebus.ca ,
by phone – 1-877-7myebus (769-3287), or by visiting the following Red Arrow Ticket Offices:


Edmonton Downtown Ticket Office
10014 – 104th Street
T5J 0Z1

Best Western Cedar Park Inn
5116 Gateway Boulevard
(North Entrance of Hotel)

Red Deer Radisson Hotel
6500 - 67th Street

Calgary Downtown Ticket Office
Tek Building (Formerly Fording Coal Building)
101, 205 – 9th Ave. SE
T2G 0R4


North Calgary Ticket Office
304 – 35th Ave NE (2 Blocks West of Edmonton Trail)

Fort McMurray Ticket Office
8217 Franklin Avenue


top

 


9. What information should I have ready when calling Ebus?
The city you will be departing from, destination of your trip, date of departure, and time of departure. Please have your name, address, and credit card ready at time of booking.
 

top

 


10. Do I have to book my trip in advance?
Advance bookings are highly recommended to guarantee yourself a seat on the date you wish to travel.


top

 


11. How far in advance must I arrive before departure?
You should arrive at least 20 minutes prior to departure. Specific seats are not reserved, only your departure time and date are reserved. The actual seat location is on a first-come, first-served basis.  Departures will not be held or delayed for last minute arrivals


top

 


12. If I need a ticket at the last minute, can I pay the driver cash?
Yes, if there are seats available. You must have exact cash because the drivers do not carry change. If you plan to purchase your ticket just before departure, it is recommended to arrive at least 20 minutes early.  Departures will not be held or delayed for last minute arrivals.


top

 


13. Is it possible to purchase a ticket in Red Deer?
Yes.  We have a desk inside the Radisson Hotel where you can purchase a ticket.  If staff is not available to purchase a ticket, you can still purchase a ticket directly from the driver with either cash, or credit card.  Drivers cannot accept debit cards.  If paying with cash please have exact change.


top

 


14. What amenities are on the Ebus?
Ebus  is equipped with lap belts, wireless internet, 110V power outlets, a washroom, and extra leg room.

 

top

 


15. Can I connect to a Red Arrow coach if I’m travelling on Ebus?
Yes you can! Please call our customer care line at 1-877-7my-ebus (769-3287) for more information on city arrival and departure connection times with Red Arrow.


top

 


16. Can my child sit on my lap?
Any child 2 years of age or older must purchase a separate seat. Newborns to 23 months of age may sit on a parent’s lap at no charge.


top

 


17. Can I bring a child’s car seat on-board?
If you wish to seat your child in their car seat next to you on-board the motorcoach, you will also be required to pay the fare for the coach seat occupied by the child's car seat. If the car seat is not being used, it must be placed underneath the coach.


top



18. Are pets allowed on board?
We will only accept a service animal that has all the proper documentation. If travelling with a service animal, please ensure you have the appropriate paperwork with you.


top



19. How many pieces of luggage can I bring on Ebus?
Passengers travelling on Ebus are allowed three (3) pieces of luggage in total, including carry-on items (2 max).  All carry-on bags must be able to fit in the overhead compartment. This includes bags, strollers, purses, duffle bags, etc. The maximum number of pieces allowed on either service is six (6).  Baggage may not be stored under the seat, or in the aisle. All extra items will be charged at $10.00 per piece (GST included). The number of extra pieces may be limited due to space constraints.


top

 
20. What are your baggage liability restrictions?
Maximum baggage liability is $350.00. Any damage must be reported to Ebus within 24 hours or claim may be refused.


top

 

21. Can I bring my bicycle?
Bikes may be transported with you while you travel on the coach. Bikes can only be accepted from our Edmonton Ticket Office and Calgary Downtown Ticket Office. The fee is $15.00 and in an effort to protect our passengers' luggage, the bike must either: 1) be packed inside a cardboard box, or 2) be wrapped in bubble wrap or a blanket that is securely fastened.
 

top

 


22. Can I bring my ski/snowboard equipment?
Skis, boots and poles must be in a bag or bound together. Snowboards must also be in a bag. They are considered one (1) piece of luggage and, as such, will be subject to the extra luggage charge of $10.00 per piece (GST included) if the maximum is exceeded.


top



23. Can I bring my golf clubs?
You can bring your golf clubs as long as the clubs are wrapped or covered. They are considered one (1) piece of luggage and, as such, will be subject to the extra luggage charge of $10.00 per piece (GST included) if the maximum is exceeded.


top

 


24. If I require a wheelchair or scooter, can I travel on Ebus?
Ebus is not equipped with wheelchair lifts. However, if you are transferable, able to walk up 8 steps on the coach on your own, and your wheelchair or scooter is able to be folded and be easily stored  under the coach, you may travel on Ebus.


top



25. Can my attendant travel with me at a reduced price?
If you have a wheelchair, are visually impaired, or require regular assistance due to a medical condition, an attendant that is fully capable of providing assistance to you can travel at no charge.


A disabled passenger is defined as:

A senior who is disabled due to age or a passenger who is legally disabled and has proof of disability such as a CNIB card, an AISH stub or a Handibus number.

 

An attendant is defined as:

Someone who is physically capable of assisting the passenger in all aspects of their trip. This includes helping them to board the coach, assisting the driver in lifting them aboard (if necessary), getting to or from a washroom at a station stop or on-board the coach, and assisting the passenger off of the coach in the case of a breakdown or emergency. The attendant may not be a child, a senior that requires assistance or another disabled person.

 
top



26. What is the maximum seat capacity on Ebus?
There are 48 seats in total. 12 rows of double seats on either side of the coach.


top

 


27. Does Ebus stop at the Calgary International Airport?
Ebus does not stop at the Calgary International Airport.  Connections to the airport can be made by Taxi from our Calgary North Office
 

top



28. Is there any available overnight or day parking when I travel with Ebus?
There is no available day or overnight parking for Ebus passengers at the pickup and drop off locations.  There are public pay parking lots across the street from the downtown Edmonton & next to the downtown Calgary locations.

 

top

 

29. I am travelling from CrossIron Mills.  Where can I park?
You may park your car at CrossIron Mills during the day.  However, overnight parking is not allowed.

top

fields.title: charter spec
fields.body_content:
ebus Customized Charter Services

 

Let ebus Get Your Group Safely Home!

ebus knows that when it comes to choosing a company to provide transportation, your priority is a Safe, Efficient and Economical service.  We're confident that our customized Charter and Shuttle programs will help take the stress out of group travel and give you the fun, relaxing transportation you need.

 

We know Alberta because we're Proud Albertans.  We've been travelling these highways as a proud Alberta company since 2011 and have been affiliated with Red Arrow Motorcoach, which has been proudly serving the communities of Alberta for over 35 years.  When choosing a company to transport your group from venue to venue, town to town, and city to city, isn't it good to know you're choosing a company that is part of your community?  We're proud to be your local favorite!

 

 

Big or small, your group is in in for a good time!

 

  • Large or Small Group Events
  • Conference Shuttle Programs
  • Community Events
  • Sports team Transportation
  • Employee Events/Meetings
  • Employe Transportation

 

 

 

 

 

Customized Service You Can Count On

At ebus we believe that every client has specific needs for their group - and one-size-fits-all service is simply not an option.  When you plan your Charter service with ebus, we promise to create a customized plan that will be uncomplicated and give you the care and attention you deserve. 

 

 

Onboard Amenties:

 

 

  • Up to 55 passenger capacity
  • Complimentary WIFI
  • Power outlets for each seat
  • Onboard lavatory

A long trip may mean hungry passengers.  We're happy to help keep your group satisfied with simple, healthy, delicious, fresh onboard meals. Please request our latest meal insert and remember that all meals are available upon early booking. We do ask that you inform us of any special dietary considerations.

 

Even More Added Touches for Your Comfort

To make your group even more more comfortable, ebus offers neck pillows and soft fleece blankets are also available upon request. 

                                              

 

For more information about our Charter services, email charters@myebus.ca or speak with a Brand Development Representative by calling our toll free number 1-877-769-3287.  

 

 

We look forward to getting to know you and taking you Safely Home.

fields.title: chasingsummer
fields.body_content:
Chasing Summer Electronic Music Festival

August 8 - 9

 

 

 

 

Why? Because it’s summer, and we should all come together to celebrate amazing music with the company of friends and fellow neighbours. Two days of music and community, taking place at the expanse of historic Fort Calgary, near the heart of the city. A lineup of some the world’s best and biggest talents in electronic dance music, with thousands of fans ready to celebrate the all-too-brief wonders of the Canadian Prairie summertime.

fields.title: Corporate Culture
fields.body_content:
A Friendly Part of Your Community Since 2011


Ebus is more than the friendly big motorcoach with the “Ebus” on the side,  we’re the friendly, economical, efficient, safe transportation company that serves the beautiful communities in Alberta.   Since our launch in 2011, our ever expanding transportation service has helped thousands of passengers get safely to their destinations in comfort and in style each and every day.  

 

  Sit back, relax, and read on as we tell you a little bit about our culture here at Ebus.

 

 

 

Whether you are looking to book travel to or from Edmonton International Airport (YEG), Calgary, Edmonton, Red Deer, Fort McMurray,  or some of the northern Alberta camps, or even just want to make a shopping trip to CrossIron Mills, Ebus offers Alberta coach service to fit a variety of inter-province transportation needs.



Focusing on Safety means focusing on YOU!


Your comfort and safety is our primary focus.  Our Safety Vision represents our commitment to Safety and is the ultimate promise we make to each other, to the communities where we operate, and to the public and customers that we value deeply. Safety is our first Core Value and is who we are and what we stand for.


Ebus focuses solely on you – our loyal customers.  Because do not focus on packages or freight transportation, our business really is all about people and our passengers. Our level of excellence in customer service is like no other and our passengers come from all walks of life. From business travelers working on the road, to students who are looking for a more economical way to travel, to seniors and families who need the peace of mind that comes with using an efficient and safe mode of transportation,  our drivers and staff are always  happy to make your trip an enjoyable and memorable experience.

 

Living Our Core Values:  We're Proud to be Part of Your Community!


Every year Ebus is happy and proud to be involved in community events, including sponsoring transportation for special groups.  We believe that serving the communities of Alberta means playing an active role in helping Albertans smile. 

 

Being positive is the Ebus way!

 

(Photo: ebus proudly supports High School Football – the eBus Punt Pass and Kick Competition – in partnership with the Edmonton Eskimos and presented by 92.5 JOE FM.  ebus also proudly sponsored the transportation for the delegates of the Network of Empowered Women (NEW) conference at Lake Louise)

 



 

 

 

 

 

We Want You to Smile and Move – and Save Money, too!


We know your time and comfort are important, so each of our motorcoaches is equipped with free WIFI, power outlets, and an onboard washroom.  Our comfortable seats each have a seat-belt for passenger safety and peace of mind.

 

We often hear passengers compliment us on the extra legroom on every coach!




 

 

 

The first two rows of every Ebus coach are designated as preferred seating for elderly and/or disabled passengers. Attendants are welcome to travel with passengers needing assistance and service animals with proper documentation are also welcome onboard.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Friendly Customized Charter Services Available

When it comes to transporting your employees, team or group, Ebus makes every trip convenient, economical, safe, and fun! Our coaches are comfortable, with plenty of leg room, lap belts, comfortable seats, complimentary wifi and power outlets.  Your dedicated driver is sure to make your trip enjoyable with a friendly smile and reliability that will give you peace of mind with every mile you travel.  Click HERE to learn more about our Charter Services!

 

 

Our Core Values

You will often hear or read our references to our Core Values.  Each Core Value represents not only our dedication to our passengers, but to our coworkers and our communities.  They are what guide our daily meetings and our decision making, and they remind us to be mindful that at all times we are working to serve the public while creating a positive work environment for all of our employees.  We take them very serious, and because of that not only do we strive to make ebus service the very best, ebus is also a very pleasant and encouraging place to work.

 

Safety | Customer Service | Resourcefulness | Integrity | Positive Attitude | Team Work | Loyalty | Accountability | Respect | Dedication

fields.title: Crossiron Mills Summer Shopping Shuttle
fields.body_content:
CrossIron Mills Summer Shopping Shuttle 

The CrossIron Mills Summer Shopping Shuttle will begin on July 1 2016, and will run throughout the summer until September 5 2016. With convenient pick up locations in Downtown Calgary, and the Calgary International Airport, planning a relaxing day of shopping has never been easier. Sit back, relax and leave the driving to us.

Round trip fares are only $15.00 per person and you can stay connected with complimentary on board WIFI and power outlets. 

 

CHILDREN CAN NOW RIDE THE SUMMER SHOPPING SHUTTLE FOR FREE*

*Children must be accompanied by a full paying adult. Children must be 14 years of age or younger.

Maximum 2 children per adult ticket (not including those under 5).

Adult ticket can be purchased online or when embarking shuttle. No purchase necessary for children.

For any questions email tourism@crossironmills.com

About Ebus Bus Transportation

Ebus makes travel to Calgary, travel to Edmonton, Fort McMurray, Red Deer or CrossIron Mills easy, affordable and comfortable.  All bus transportation by ebus is equipped with lap belts, wireless internet, 110V power outlets, a washroom, and extra leg room so you can sit back, relax and let Ebus do the driving for you!


Ebus is owned and operated by Red Arrow Motorcoach, part of the Pacific Western Group of companies. Ebus bus transportation offers economical, efficient and safe transportation for travel between Fort McMurray, Edmonton, Red Deer and Calgary.

 

Ebus Core Values

Safety | Customer Service | Resourcefulness | Integrity | Positive Attitude | Team Work Loyalty | Accountability | Respect | Dedication

fields.title: ebus to EIA
fields.body_content:
Ebus Direct Service to Edmonton International Airport

Your next travel adventure just got a whole lot easier!

 

We're proud to now offer direct service to EIA and its 60 plus non-stop destinations!  Ebus service is stress-free, comfortable and safe, and our schedules are perfectly timed for many connections at the airport, in particular Icelandair.  What a great opportunity for adventure travelers in Alberta to take off and explore!

 

Edmonton International Airport offers daily flight service around the world, including airline such as Icelandair (ICE), which offers non-stop service between Edmonton and Reykjavik (Keflavik) on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday and Saturdays.

 

 

 

 _________

 For more information and Ebus schedules you may visit the

Edmonton International Airport Information Desk located on the arrivals level near door 7

_________

Ebus Pick-up/Drop-off area at YEG is located at Courtesy Shuttle Area outside of DOORS 9 or 10 (they're close to each other)

fields.title: edmontonfringefestival
fields.body_content:
Edmonton Fringe Theatre Festival

August 14 - 24

 

The Edmonton International Fringe Festival produced by the Fringe Theatre Adventures (FTA) is an annual event held every August in Edmonton, Alberta in Canada. It is the oldest and largest Fringe Theatre Festival in North America. More than 1,500 performers take part in the festival each year.

 

The fringe festival is the largest in North America. In addition to the hundreds of national and international artists who travel from around the world to bring their shows to the Edmonton Fringe, there are also hundreds of local performers who participate each year. 

 

Click here to see the full calendar of events and get your tickets!

fields.title: Join Our Team
fields.body_content:
We're Hiring!

Passenger safety is our #1 priority at ebus, and transports Albertans to our travel destinations on our Prevost motorcoaches s what we do the best. Each ebus coach is well recognized on our highways, with our Safely Home brand and big "e" on the side. Greeting our passengers with a smile and being the ambassadors of our Core Values is part of what makes our drivers stand out as some of the very best in Canada.  We’re proud to call our team more than just employees, we’re family. If you are an experienced driver looking for a new and positive career in the transportation industry here in Alberta, take a look at our available opportunities and consider becoming part of the ebus team.

 

Join Our Team as an ebus Motorocoach Operator

We are currently seeking experienced Full Time Motorcoach Operators in Edmonton, and Part Time /Casual Operators in Calgary.

 

 

Essential Qualifications

- Must be 25 years of age or older
- Possess a valid Class 1 or 2 License with Air Brake Endorsement
- 5 years experience driving a Motorcoach
- Provide a current 3 year drivers Abstract
- Pass a Criminal Reference Check
- Pass a Pre-Employment Road Test
- Pass a Pre-Employment Drug/Alcohol Test

Essential Skills Include:
- Numeracy
- Oral & written communication
- Working with others
- Problem solving
- Decision making
- Hours of Service
- Computer use
- Friendly, service-oriented personality

 

Locations: Calgary and Edmonton

Terms of Employment:

Calgary - Part-Time/Casual positions available
Edmonton - Full Time Positions Available

Please email your resume and references to: don@redarrow.ca

Tags: Drivers, Transporation, Driving Jobs,

 

"As President of the Red Arrow Driver's Association, I'd like to invite you to become part of our team.  Our drivers are some of the best in the business and make working together enjoyable, fun, and rewarding.  Transporting people safely is our priority and enjoying what we do each and every day is part of our culture. If you are looking for a great career in a great business, consider Red Arrow." ~ Butch Wilson, Motorcoach Operator

fields.meta_description: eBus is an Alberta coach bus service offering a varied Calgary bus schedule, as well as bus service in Edmonton, Red Deer, Fort McMurray and CrossIron Mills.
fields.title: Learn more about our Calgary Bus Service & Edmonton Bus Routes | MyEBus.ca
fields.body_content:
About Ebus

Explore Alberta with the safety and comfort of Ebus, an Alberta coach service launched in 2011. Offering an extensive network of scheduled routes for reliable transportation across the province, ebus specializes in coach service to and from Edmonton, Red Deer, Calgary, Fort McMurray and CrossIron Mills. Ebus provides Albertans with the options of economical, efficient and safe transportation.


Traveling as a group? Ebus also provides charter service for groups of various sizes. Our comfortable coaches are ideal for groups travelling for business or pleasure, local or long distance.

 

Safety and Comfort


The Ebus fleet consists of H3 and X3-45 motorcoaches from Prevost. The H3-45 is what Prevost calls their "tallest, roomiest, proudest" model, with an overall height of 12 feet, 5 inches and a long wheelbase which provides the smoothest, most stable ride and the most head room and comfort for all of our passengers.  Each Prevost coach also comes equiped with GPS tracking and is powered by low-emission clean-diesel engines, providing a more environmentally friendly travel alternative. Every ebus coach goes through a thorough safety inspection and our experienced drivers go through rigorous training for all road and weather conditions both in our training simulator and on the road. Our comfortable seats each have a seat-belt for passenger safety and peace of mind.

 

The first two rows of every Ebus coach are designated as preferred seating for elderly and/or disabled passengers. Attendants are welcome to travel with passengers needing assistance and service animals with proper documentation are also welcome onboard.

 

Savings and Convenience


Ebus offers two affordable fare options for the budget traveller.  Passengers who book their Ebus tickets online will also receive a 5 % on their fare.  Book Your Ticket Now.


Our passengers' time and comfort is important to us. Ebus motorcoaches are equipped with free WIFI, power outlets, an onboard washroom, and plenty of extra legroom.

 

Welcome Aboard ebus!

 

Whether you are looking to book travel to or from Calgary, Edmonton, Red Deer, or Fort McMurray, or even just want to make a shopping trip to CrossIron Mills, Ebus offers Alberta coach service to fit a variety of inter-province transportation needs. With a growing number of routes and a convenient schedule, Ebus' discounted travel options never looked better.

 

Ebus is owned and operated by Red Arrow Motorcoach and is part of the Pacific Western Group of companies.

 

 

Safely Home

 

Safely Home is more than a slogan; it is a combination of the focus on the communities we work in and serve, and our commitment to them through our people.


So what does Safely Home mean to Ebus?  It means taking safety seriously on a personal level throughout our company.  It’s about making good choices for ourselves, our co-workers, passengers and the public. It is a declaration of our absolute commitment to safety in everything we do and, ultimately, it is about getting each and every one of us and our passengers Safely Home at the end of our respective journeys.


Safely Home reminds us that Safety our first Core Value and is who we are and what we stand for. We are very proud to say that Safely Home is the heart of Ebus.

 

 

Our Safety Vision

Safely Home is our deep conviction to Safety and the ultimate promise we make to each other, to our clients, and to the communities in which we operate. The Pacific Western Group of Companies is driven by safety. It is our first Core Value, and it is at the heart of all we do.

 

 

 

Our Mission Statement

Our mission is to exceed customer expectations by employing talented people who share in the dedication of a company committed to Safety and Service.

 



Our Core Values

Safety - Customer Service - Resourcefulness - Integrity - Positive Attitude - Teamwork - Loyalty - Accountability - Respect - Dedication

 Follow us:

fields.title: Luggage Policy
fields.body_content:
Luggage Policy

Passengers travelling on Ebus are allowed three (3) pieces of luggage in total, including carry-on items (2 max). Carry-on bags which must be able to fit into the overhead compartment.  The maximum number of pieces allowed on is six (6).   Charges for extra luggage are noted below.  

  • Carry-on items considered include briefcases, laptop bags, purses, small back packs, diaper bags and such.
  • One item may be kept on the passenger’s lap OR on the floor between the seat and your feet.
  • Carry-on items cannot be stored under the seat as there is wiring that runs under the seats.
  • The aisle must be kept clear of carry-on items, including shoulder straps. 
  • Alcohol is not permitted onboard under any circumstances.

Dimensions of Overhead Bins

60” wide, 10” deep, 8¾” high angling to 7½” high at the back. 

Charges for Extra Luggage

  • Passengers will be charged for all additional luggage at the rate of $10.00 per piece (includes GST). Bicycles may be transported at a cost of $15.00 each (includes GST) and must be boxed or wrapped (see “Protection of Luggage” below).
  • Ebus does not carry freight, as such, we have the right to refuse items deemed not to be essential or luggage. As well, we reserve the right to limit the size, weight and the number of items you wish to check in.
  • The maximum extra bags allowed on Ebus is three (3) for a maximum of six (6). Exceeding the total number of bags allowed is not negotiable.

Essential Items

Items deemed essential for the wellbeing of our passengers will be transported at no charge. These items would include: walking or mobility aids/devices, car seats, and oxygen canisters. 

Protection of Luggage

  • In an effort to protect all luggage stored under the coach, items should be packed or covered in such a way as to not be damaged during transit or not to damage other luggage. It is important that items of a breakable nature (TV’s) or those that contain pointy (ski poles) or greasy (bike chains) parts are secured by a box, suitable covering, or plastic wrap/bags.
  • It is recommended that electronics, items of value and fragile items be carried on board and stored in the overhead bins.
  • To avoid luggage mix ups, it is recommended that you place a visible identifier on your stored luggage including a luggage tag with your name, address and phone number. ebus is not responsible for a passenger picking up the wrong piece of luggage.
  • It is your responsibility to ensure your checked luggage is placed in the correct compartment prior to departure as well, it is your responsibility to remove all personal items brought on to the coach, Ebus will not be responsible for items left behind on the coach or luggage issues as a result of a change in your arrival point.
  • Please ensure you clearly advise the representative loading your luggage of your arrival point, to ensure your luggage is placed into the appropriate compartment.
  • Found items are kept for a 30 day period, after which time they will be disposed of. 

Weight Restrictions for Luggage

For any piece of luggage over 60 lbs., the driver may ask the passenger to load and unload their luggage at the pick-up and drop-off points. The passenger must be capable of loading the luggage. 

Firearms

A firearm may be transported as long as it is in a proper locked case and must be placed under the coach. The firearm cannot be taken out at any mid-trip stops ( i.e. Red Deer or Grassland) unless that is the end point for the passenger. A hard case is preferred, but not mandatory. We DO NOT transport ammunition. 

Damaged/Lost Luggage

Ebus will not be responsible for the loss of or damage to, checked luggage in excess of stated maximum liability. In addition, Ebus does not accept liability to loss off or damage to unchecked baggage carried on board. 

Maximum baggage liability is $350.00. Any damage must be reported to Ebus within 24 hours or claim may be refused.

CrossIron Mills Service

As of January 9, 2012, ebus will begin service to Cross Iron Mills in Calgary.

 

The ebus - CrossIron Mills service will operate as follows:  On all Southbound trips from Edmonton and Red Deer, the bus will stop at CrossIron Mills on request only. All Northbound trips out of Calgary to Red Deer and Edmonton will automatically stop at CrossIron Mills.  Pick-up and drop-off location is Entrance #2 (Ranch Entrance).

We are located halfway between Edmonton and Calgary right off highway 2 which give easy access to anyone coming from the nearby cities. Take advantage of our safe, economical and convenient direct service to Beaver River, Athabasca Lodge, Pebble Beach and Wapasu Creek !  Service to camps will operate every 10 days to coincide with the staff change schedule.  Please refer to the schedule's below.

fields.title: wellgetyouthere
fields.body_content:
ebus in partnership with Travel Alberta is showcasing some of the best events happening in Alberta.  With ebus traveling to the top destinations in the province, including Edmonton, Red Deer, Calgary and Fort McMurray, experiencing the best events this province has to offer is as easy as booking a ticket and heading on the road to adventure.  

Click on the images to take a further look at some of the attractions, events, and accomodations,  and visit their websites for more information about what's happening! We’ll get you there!

 

Fort McMurray Tourism

From arts and culture to amazing concerts, great food, recreation and beautiful scenery, Fort McMurray is an exciting Alberta getaway destination!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

CheckinCanada.com

Check In Canada is our way of making sure that you get the same service you have come to expect from Canada's best hotels.

 


Edmonton International Street Performers Festival 

July 4 - 13

The 30th annual Edmonton International Street Performers Festival is home to over 1500 outdoor performances by musicians, jugglers, acrobats and unicyclists and more.

 

 



Edmonton Fringe Theatre Festival - August 14 - 24

The Edmonton International Fringe Festival is the oldest and largest Fringe Theatre Festival in North America with hundreds of local national and international artists who travel from around the world.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

SONiC BOOM - August 29 - 31

SONiCBOOM is Edmonton’s Alternative Music Festival, taking place over three days August 29-31st. This is Edmonton’s premiere alternative music outdoor event!

 

 

 

 

Holiday Inn Express - Downtown

The Holiday Inn Express Downtown has comfortable and spacious accommodations, whether you are traveling for business or pleasure.

 

 

 

 

CheckinCanada.com

 

Check In Canada is our way of making sure that you get the same service you have come to expect from Canada's best hotels. 

 

 

 

 

Stay at the iHotel

We are located halfway between Edmonton and Calgary right off highway 2 which give easy access to anyone coming from the nearby cities.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

CheckinCanada.com

Check In Canada is our way of making sure that you get the same service you have come to expect from Canada's best hotels.

 

 

 



 

Chasing Summer Electronic Music Festival - August 8 - 9

Two days of music and community, taking place at the expanse of historic Fort Calgary, near the heart of the city. A lineup of some the world’s best and biggest talents in electronic dance music.

 

 

 

 



 

X-Fest - August 30 - 31

X-FEST, Calgary’s Alternative Music Festival, takes place over two days at Fort Calgary in Calgary, Alberta, Canada on August 30 and 31st, 2014. 

 

 

 

 

 

 GlobalFest - August 14 - 23

GlobalFest is an inclusive, world class, multi-faceted arts and culture festival that celebrates and showcases cultural diversity and artistic excellence in our communities and across the globe. It's Alberta's most explosive festival!

 

 

 

 

 

CheckinCanada.com

fields.title: xfest
fields.body_content:
X-Fest

August 30 - 31

 

Calgary’s Alternative X92.9 and Union Events are pleased to announce the lineup for the fourth X-FEST, Calgary’s Alternative Music Festival, taking place over two days at Fort Calgary in Calgary, Alberta, Canada on August 30 and 31st, 2014. 

 

Renowned American rock artist JACK WHITE and British chart-toppers ARCTIC MONKEYS lead an incredible lineup that also includes indie rockers DEATH CAB FOR CUTIE and FOSTER THE PEOPLE, 2014 Juno award winners TEGAN & SARA and SERENA RYDER, Kentucky rock band CAGE THE ELEPHANT, the explosive FITZ & THE TANTRUMS, and American breakouts THE AIRBORNE TOXIC EVENT.

 

CLICK HERE for more information and to get your tickets!

Privacy Statement

Ebus collects personal information for the purposes of securing the customer's travel arrangements, and identifying preferences to serve each customer better in the future.

All personal information retained by Ebus will only be used or disclosed for the purpose for which it was collected. All customer information is retained for a 24 month period from the date of last travel.

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact our Privacy Officer by phone at 1-800-232-1958 or by email at privacy@myebus.ca.

Ebus Terms and Conditions

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING CAREFULLY.

Time Change and Cancellation Policy
Reservations are NON-REFUNDABLE and NON-exchangeable. Fares are non-refundable, non-transferrable and non-changeable unless upgrading to a Red Arrow Departure on the same date of travel.  Once upgraded, Red Arrow fares also become non-refundable.

Online Bookings
It is your responsibility to ensure that your on line bookings are correct. You have several opportunities while making your reservation as well as receiving a print out or email to verify the correctness of your booking. ebus will not be responsible for bookings you have made incorrectly.

General Terms and Conditions
While Ebus wants to be the Bus Line you travel with because of our quality of service, reliability and fun attitude, we still need to let you know about the legalities. This document sets out those terms and conditions (the "Agreement") under which ebus ("we", "us", "our") allow you ("you", "your") to use our website ("Website"), whether you do so just to find out about us and our services or to carry out booking of travel services and other activities using the Website.

If you are visiting our Website as what we call a Visitor (see below for definitions), your use of the Website confirms that you agree to this Agreement. To access other services or parts of the Website, you may have to confirm that you have read, accepted and agreed to this Agreement by clicking on "Accept" or you will not be able to view or use those portions of the Website.

THIS AGREEMENT LIMITS THE LIABILITY OF EBUS, GRANTS YOU A LIMITED LICENSE AND GIVES Ebus OWNERSHIP OF AND CONTROL OVER INFORMATION YOU PROVIDE. ALL PERSONAL INFORMATION PROVIDED BY INDIVIDUALS ALSO BECOMES SUBJECT TO Ebus’s APPLICABLE PRIVACY STATEMENT.

1. Definitions: Many of the words and phrases in this Agreement have specific meanings so we have provided those for you to read:

a) Who are you? Who you are makes a difference in how this Agreement affects you. You may visit or use the Website in different roles at different times as follows:

  • Visitor - a Visitor is anyone who visits the publicly available parts of our Website but who is not asked to click "accept". Visitors can access information from the Website's publicly available areas without telling us anything about themselves, but by using the Website Visitors still accept the terms and conditions of this Agreement. Visitors cannot access areas of the Website requiring a password, cannot book travel services, and cannot access the Data.
  • Guest - A Guest is an individual traveling with ebus, obtaining travel services from or through ebus or any other entity, whether in connection with travel services from or through ebus or otherwise. "Guests" include individual Agents who book trips for themselves and also include the individuals with respect to whom an Agent makes travel arrangements. A Guest may book their services personally and/or directly, or they may use an Agent to do so. A Guest may access the Website as a Visitor on a different occasion without logging in. "Guest" includes a client of a travel agent and an employee or other person with respect to whom an Agent makes travel arrangements. "Guest" also includes any person who enrolls in our Guest program, or who is accessing the Website to view Data or other information about themselves or another individual on whose behalf they are authorized to act, such other information including travel itineraries.
  • Agent - An Agent is any person who books travel services on behalf of another individual in any manner. You are an Agent if you fit within any of the following:
  1. You are booking travel services on behalf of a friend, parent, child, spouse or other family member (but with respect to bookings you make for yourself, you are a Guest); or
  2. You are a travel agent, or you are an employee, officer, director, contractor or agent of a travel agent (unless you are an agent but booking your own arrangements, in which case you are a Guest); or
  3. You are, or are an employee, officer, director, contractor or agent of, an organization, corporation or other entity with which ebus has entered into an agreement in order to allow such organization access to the Website in order to carry out its own booking and arrangement of travel services on behalf of its employees and others (we call those "Corporate Bookings") and you are acting on its behalf (unless you are booking your own arrangements, in which case you are a Guest).

b) Other Terms to Know:

  1. "act on behalf of", or similar words, means to enter into contracts or agreements in the name of or on behalf of a Guest, which must be with their knowledge, consent and authority (unless they are a minor and you are their parent or guardian and have the legal right to do so on their behalf), and includes making travel arrangements or bookings, contracting for the supply of wares or services and supplying personal information of a Guest or other individual in connection with doing so.
  2. The "Data" means any and all records, documents, data and information related to travel arrangements and bookings for Guests, including without limitation information with respect to all travel arrangements, itineraries and schedules, contact persons, holders of credit cards, dates and times of trip arrival, arrival and departure dates and times, Personal Information related to Guests and persons accompanying Guests, bookings on other carriers, including air lines, bus lines, limousines, chauffeurs, tour operators and similar service providers, rental car bookings, and related matters.
  3. "Personal Information" means all information about a Guest, about you, or about any other identifiable individual, including, without limitation, name, date of birth, age, gender, travel arrangements, financial information, credit card and billing information, health information, seating preferences, height, weight, and any and all other information related to or that can be connected with an identifiable individual.

2. Purpose for Access: You agree that the purpose for our providing you with access to the Website is to allow you to obtain information and (where applicable) upload, download, create, edit, modify, add to and delete from the Data for purposes reasonably connected to making, modifying, booking, viewing, checking and managing the travel plans, schedules, itineraries and arrangements of you and/or Guests on behalf of whom you have the authority to do so, and in addition to generate and review reports on your activities, or those of Guests you act on behalf of as may be permitted by Ebus from time to time. Once received by Ebus, the Data becomes part of a database, which ebus owns. Any Personal Information in the Data will be collected, used and disclosed by ebus pursuant to consent provided by you and the ebus Privacy Statement.

3. Your Warranty and Representations to ebus: You warrant and represent to ebus as follows:

a) Except where you are making your own travel arrangements, or where you act on behalf of a minor and are that minor's guardian or parent, you have the full and complete authority and consent of the Guest to enter, upload, download, edit, modify, add to and delete from the Data with respect to the Guest, including their Personal Information;

b) If you act on behalf of an organization, whether a travel agency (on behalf of a Guest) or are making Corporate Bookings on behalf of Guests related to or of another organization, that organization has implemented a legally compliant privacy policy and appointed responsible individuals with respect to the collection, use and disclosure of personal information, including by you;

c) By accessing the Website and/or adding to, deleting or modifying Data with respect to any Guest, you are not breaching any contract, duty or law or infringing anyone's intellectual property, privacy or other legal rights; and,

d) You are aware of the contents of this Agreement and agree to follow its terms and conditions.

4. Compliance with Rules and Regulations: You agree to follow all the rules and regulations set by ebus from time to time. Those rules and regulations are currently as set out in this Agreement, as well as in all applicable tariffs filed by ebus. These rules and regulations will apply to use of any kind of the Website and access to the Data and will apply to you whether you are an Agent or a Guest, or, as applicable, a Visitor.

5. Your Agreement: You agree that at all times:

a) Your access to this Website is for your use for the stated purposes in this Agreement only. You will not allow or provide access to this Website to any unauthorized person or any person under the full age of majority in your jurisdiction, unless such access is continuously supervised by you;

b) If you are a bona fide Agent, as defined in this Agreement, your access to this Website is permitted solely for the purposes of carrying out your role as an Agent, and any access or use other than as permitted to an Agent is prohibited. You are permitted to access this Website and download copies of content from this Website for use within your own organization only to the extent reasonably required to fulfill your obligations to the other individual or individuals for whom you are booking travel services;

c) If you are a bona fide Visitor or a Guest, you are permitted to access this Website and download copies of content from this Website for non-commercial and personal use only;

d) You will not copy, distribute, or disclose the Data or Personal Information with respect to any Guest without their consent, or post it online or otherwise make it public or available to any unauthorized persons;

e) You will not divulge any user name, password or other account information provided to you to anyone else;

f) To the best of your knowledge, any Personal Information given by you to ebus is true, complete and accurate and is given with the knowledge and consent of the individual Guest or other person concerned; and,

g) Any and all content, information and data of any kind displayed on, contained in, or accessible through this Website, including but not limited to the Data in ebuss databases (collectively, the "Content"), is subject to copyright and other intellectual property rights of ebus or its licensors, all rights reserved. Any access to this Website, and any downloading, copying, distribution, dissemination or other use or possession whatsoever of the Content, other than as expressly permitted in this Agreement, is prohibited. Any commercial use or copying of any of the Content other than for the purposes of considering ebus as your provider of travel services or booking travel services for specific individuals as a bona fide Agent is contrary to this Agreement and not permitted. Without limitation, engaging in data mining, data processing, "screen scraping", or the use or application of any automated script, macro, program, application, software, "bot" or similar technical device to extract, process, copy, distribute, data mine, aggregate, collate, cross-reference or manipulate the Content, or any information or data contained in, displayed on, or accessible or available in any manner from or through this Website is strictly prohibited, provided however that bots, spiders or similar programs used by bona fide search engines to index the initial home pages in English and French of this Website for search purposes available to the general public via ordinary web browser applications are permitted to carry out their bona fide indexing functions on a limited and reasonable basis.

6. Withdrawal of Access for Cause: This agreement grants no rights, only privileges and permission. You agree that ebus, in its absolute discretion, will be the sole judge of whether you have breached any provision of this Agreement and that any privileges or permission granted to you as an individual under this Agreement may be revoked, suspended or terminated by ebus at any time without notice.

7. Waiver: You acknowledge that the Internet and websites accessed by you are inherently dangerous and subject to computer, system and network failure as well as nasty human activity. While ebus will take such steps as are reasonable in the circumstances to maintain the security of this Website and the Data and your privacy and confidentiality with respect to information you provide, you agree that you use this Website completely at your own risk and that in no event shall ebus be held liable for any loss or damages, however caused, except as expressly provided in this Agreement, even if caused by the negligence of ebus.

8. Disclaimer: EBUS DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THIS WEBSITE WILL OPERATE ERROR-FREE OR THAT IT AND ITS SERVER OR SERVERS ARE OR WILL BE FREE OF COMPUTER VIRUSES, TROJAN HORSES, OR OTHER HARMFUL CONTENT, DEVICES OR PROGRAMS. THIS WEBSITE AND ITS CONTENT AND MATERIAL, AND ACCESS TO THE DATA, ARE ALL PROVIDED ON AN "AS IS, WHERE IS", AND "AS AND WHEN AVAILABLE" BASIS WITHOUT ANY REPRESENTATIONS, GUARANTEES, CONDITIONS OR WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND. TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY THE LAW, EBUS DISCLAIMS ANY AND ALL CONDITIONS AND WARRANTIES, WHETHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING THE CONDITION OR WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY AND THE CONDITION OR WARRANTY OF FITNESS FOR ANY PARTICULAR PURPOSE. EBUS MAKES NO WARRANTY OR REPRESENTATION OF NON-INFRINGEMENT. EBUS FURTHER MAKES NO WARRANTIES OR REPRESENTATIONS CONCERNING THE ACCURACY, RELIABILITY, COMPLETENESS, OR TIMELINESS OF THE DATA ACCESSED BY USE OF THE WEBSITE.

9. Limitation of Damages: You further agree that IN NO EVENT WILL EBUS BE LIABLE FOR indirect, general, special, economic, consequential, EXEMPLARY or punitive damages resulting from the use of this Website, whether in tort, contract or any other cause of action, including without limitation, for loss of data, information or programs, or damage to computers or networks, or from breach of privacy and similar personal rights, or from infringement of intellectual property rights, OR FROM DEFAMATION, LIBEL OR SLANDER, or any other damages whatsoever, whether or not ebus shall have been advised of the possibility of such damages. THE TOTAL LIABILITY OF EBUS shall in all cases be limited to a MAXIMUM of the SUM OF ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($100.00) IN CANADIAN CURRENCY.

10. Further Disclaimer of ebus: While ebus will make reasonable commercial efforts to make the Data available on a reasonable basis, ebus accepts no obligation to do so on any pre-agreed basis or at all. ebus may interrupt access to the Data, or terminate access to the Data at any time, without notice or liability. Access to the Data shall in all cases be a privilege and not a right or proprietary interest of any kind. Subject to its privacy policies and applicable law, ebus shall be free to modify, change, delete, and generally deal with the Data as it sees fit. Other parties may have access to the Data and can change, modify, amend or delete the Data. ebus has no control over such third parties and no event will ebus be liable for any reliance by you on the Data.

11. Evidence: Computer records stored in reasonably secure conditions by ebus with respect to the Data, the Website and your access to them will be accepted as conclusive evidence of your conduct, communications and dealings with the Data and the Website. Computer records will be deemed to be stored in reasonably secure conditions if systematically recorded on a durable and inalterable medium, including a write-protected disk, tape, CD or DVD or similar medium, or, if upon an alterable medium, upon reasonable proof that such record has not been altered.

12. Injunctive and Similar Relief: You agree that any breach by you of this Agreement will not be fully compensable in damages and you therefore agree that ebus shall be entitled to immediate equitable, injunctive and other similar relief against you without notice and without the necessity of proving damages or the likelihood of damages.

13. Indemnity: You agree to indemnify and save harmless ebus for any damages sustained should you breach your warranties and representations or any term or condition of this Agreement.

14. Grant of Limited License: ebus grants to you a non-exclusive, limited and revocable license to download and view the Data and other content available on this Website on your computer for the purposes stated in this Agreement and no other purposes.

15. Non-Assignment by You: You may not assign this Agreement. It is and shall remain personal to you.

16. Termination: ebus may terminate this Agreement at any time with or without notice to you and may act unreasonably in so doing, in its absolute discretion. You may not terminate this Agreement, which shall remain in force, with such provision, without limitation, to apply pursuant to any agreement between ebus and, if you are an Agent, any organization you are employed with or on whose behalf you access the Data. However, you may advise ebus that you wish your access account rendered inactive and we will do so.

17. Entire Agreement: Subject to any other applicable agreements to which ebus may be a party, this is the entire agreement, contract and understanding between you and ebus.

18. Other Sites: You agree that ebus has no control over the content or performance of any website linked to or from this Website, that ebus expresses no opinion concerning the content or performance of any such website, and that ebus shall in no event be held liable or responsible for the content of any such website.

19. Governing Law: This Agreement shall in all respects be governed by the laws of the Province of Alberta, Canada and the laws of Canada in effect in the said Province at the time. You agree that any and all disputes will be adjudicated only by the courts of Alberta. You expressly submit to and attorn to the exclusive jurisdiction of such courts, and you undertake and agree to bring no complaint and file no action in any other Court whatsoever. Nothing contained in this section shall prevent ebus from commencing an action in any court of competent jurisdiction in order to seek damages and/or equitable relief against you for breach of this Agreement.

20. Severance and Enurement: Should any portion or portions of this Agreement be held by a Court of competent jurisdiction to be unenforceable, then such portion or portions shall be severed from this Agreement, and the remaining portions of the Agreement shall be enforced. This Agreement shall enure to the benefit of the heirs, executors, administrators and permitted assigns of you and ebus, including its subsidiaries and affiliates.

21. Copyright and Trademark Notices: All contents of the ebus website are: Copyright © ebus. Other trade-marks of third parties on the website are the property of such parties, used with permission. All rights are expressly reserved.

22. Social Media Policy: ebus uses Social Media networks, specifically Facebook and Twitter, to share and promote service changes, service updates, specials and promotions with our customers.  We welcome participation and discussion through our Social Media channels. We have the right, at our discretion, to remove any posts containing personal attacks, profanity, nudity, hate speech or illegal material from our Social Media channels, as well as revoke privileges to post to our pages. Passengers and individuals should not use these services (i.e. contact our Twitter or Facebook accounts) to post commercial posts or request ticket information, purchases, ticket changes, specific travel quotes, or other personal travel service requests. Also, for your privacy protection, we also request that passengers do not post personal contact information to our Social Network channels. All passenger inquiries should be directed to our website www.myebus.ca  to our toll free phone 1-877-769-3287.   ebus will do its best to ensure all messaging sent out via Social Media is accurate and timely; however prices, services and specials may be subject to change without notice. Our Social Media channels are not monitored 24/7. Opinions expressed in non- ebus generated posts are not necessarily those of ebus and its employees, and we cannot guarantee the accuracy of these posts.  If you have any questions about our use of Social Media, please contact socialmedia@myebus.ca.
